name: Asparagus Casserole II
author: STERRY
summary: This is a recipe my mother always made on special occasions--it was the only casserole dish my father would eat.  My husband had never eaten asparagus until we married 25 years ago and now always requests this dish when asked what he would like on special occasions.  It is so easy and so delicious!
ingredients: 2 (10.75 ounce) cans  condensed cream of mushroom soup
directions: Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water
Bring water to a boil and immediately remove from heat
Cover and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes
Remove from hot water, cool and peel and slice
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
In the prepared dish layer 1 1/2 cans of asparagus, 1 can mushroom soup, 2 eggs and 1 cup of crushed crackers
Cover and bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes
Remove cover and top with grated cheese
Cover and bake an additional 5 minutes, or until cheese is melted
